t: Song of Solomon 2
I*pn am*i the rose of Sharon, And*ild the lily of the valleys.
The Beloved
Like*pn a lily among thorns, So*ld is my love among the daughters.
The Shulamite
Like*pn an apple tree among the trees of the woods, So*ld is*i my beloved among the sons. I*ld sat down in his shade with great delight, And*ld his fruit was*i sweet to my taste.
The Shulamite to the Daughters of Jerusalem
He*pn brought me to the banqueting house, And*ld his banner over me was*i love.
Sustain*ld me with cakes of raisins, Refresh*ld me with apples, For*ld I am*i lovesick.
His*ln left hand is*i under my head, And*ld his right hand embraces me.
I*ld charge you, O daughters of Jerusalem, By*ld the gazelles or by the does of the field, Do*ld not stir up nor awaken love Until*ld it pleases.
The Beloved’s Request
The Shulamite
The*pn voice of my beloved! Behold,*ld he comes Leaping*ld upon the mountains, Skipping*ld upon the hills.
My*ld beloved is like a gazelle or a young stag. Behold,*ld he stands behind our wall; He*ld is looking through the windows, Gazing*ld through the lattice.
My*ln beloved spoke, and said to me: “Rise*ld up, my love, my fair one, And*ld come away.
For*ld lo, the winter is past, The*ld rain is over and*i gone.
The*ld flowers appear on the earth; The*ld time of singing has come, And*ld the voice of the turtledove Is*ld heard in our land.
The*ld fig tree puts forth her green figs, And*ld the vines with*i the tender grapes Give*ld a good*i smell. Rise*ld up, my love, my fair one, And*ld come away!
“O*ln my dove, in the clefts of the rock, In*ld the secret places*i of the cliff, Let*ld me see your face, Let*ld me hear your voice; For*ld your voice is*i sweet, And*ld your face is*i lovely.”
Her Brothers
Catch*pn us the foxes, The*ld little foxes that spoil the vines, For*ld our vines have*i tender grapes.
The Shulamite
My*pn beloved is*i mine, and I am*i his. He*ld feeds his*i flock*i among the lilies.
(To Her Beloved)
Until*pn the day breaks And*ld the shadows flee away, Turn,*ld my beloved, And*ld be like a gazelle Or*ld a young stag Upon*ld the mountains of Bether.
